resources.name: fuel_ferc1
resources.title: fuel_ferc1
resources.description: Annual fuel consumed by large thermal generating plants. As reported on page 402 of FERC Form 1.

fields.name: record_id
fields.description: Identifier indicating original FERC Form 1 source record. format: {table_name}_{report_year}_{report_prd}_{respondent_id}_{spplmnt_num}_{row_number}. Unique within FERC Form 1 DB tables which are not row-mapped.

fields.name: utility_id_ferc1
fields.description: FERC assigned respondent_id, identifying the reporting entity. Stable from year to year.

fields.name: report_year
fields.description: Four-digit year in which the data was reported.

fields.name: plant_name_ferc1
fields.description: Name of the plant, as reported to FERC. This is a freeform string, not guaranteed to be consistent across references to the same plant.

fields.name: fuel_type_code_pudl
fields.description: PUDL assigned code indicating the general fuel type.

fields.name: fuel_unit
fields.description: PUDL assigned code indicating reported fuel unit of measure.

fields.name: fuel_qty_burned
fields.description: Quantity of fuel consumed in the report year, in terms of the reported fuel units.

fields.name: fuel_mmbtu_per_unit
fields.description: Average heat content of fuel consumed in the report year, in mmBTU per reported fuel unit.

fields.name: fuel_cost_per_unit_burned
fields.description: Average cost of fuel consumed in the report year, in nominal USD per reported fuel unit.

fields.name: fuel_cost_per_unit_delivered
fields.description: Average cost of fuel delivered in the report year, in nominal USD per reported fuel unit.

fields.name: fuel_cost_per_mmbtu
fields.description: Average cost of fuel consumed in the report year, in nominal USD per mmBTU of fuel heat content.

fields.name: region_id_epaipm
fields.description: Name of the IPM region

fields.name: month
fields.description: Month of the year

fields.name: day_of_year
fields.description: Day of the year

fields.name: hour
fields.description: Hour of the day (0-23). Original IPM values were 1-24.

fields.name: time_index
fields.description: 8760 index hour of the year

fields.name: load_mw
fields.description: Load (MW) in an hour of the day for the IPM region

fields.name: plant_id_eia
fields.description: The unique six-digit facility identification number, also called an ORISPL, assigned by the Energy Information Administration.

fields.name: region
fields.description: Name of the IPM region

resources.name: ferc_depreciation_lines
resources.title: ferc_depreciation_lines
resources.description: PUDL assigned FERC Form 1 line identifiers and long descriptions from FERC Form 1 page 219, Accumulated Provision for Depreciation of Electric Utility Plant (Account 108).

fields.name: line_id
fields.description: A human readable string uniquely identifying the FERC depreciation account. Used in lieu of the actual line number, as those numbers are not guaranteed to be consistent from year to year.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description of the FERC depreciation account, as listed on FERC Form 1, Page 219.

fields.name: utility_id_eia
fields.description: The EIA Utility Identification number.

fields.name: utility_name_eia
fields.description: The name of the utility.

fields.name: utility_id_pudl
fields.description: A manually assigned PUDL utility ID. May not be stable over time.

fields.name: datasource
fields.description: Code identifying a dataset available within PUDL.

fields.name: active
fields.description: Indicates whether or not the dataset has been pulled into PUDL by the extract transform load process.

resources.name: utilities_pudl
resources.title: PUDL Utilities
resources.description: Home table for PUDL assigned utility IDs. These IDs are manually generated each year when new FERC and EIA reporting is integrated, and any newly found utilities are added to the list with a new ID. Each ID maps to a power plant owning or operating entity which is reported in at least one FERC or EIA data set. This table is read in from a spreadsheet stored in the PUDL repository: src/pudl/package_data/glue/mapping_eia923_ferc1.xlsx

fields.name: utility_id_pudl
fields.description: A manually assigned PUDL utility ID. May not be stable over time.

fields.name: utility_name_pudl
fields.description: Utility name, chosen arbitrarily from the several possible utility names available in the utility matching process. Included for human readability only.

fields.name: utility_id_ferc1
fields.description: FERC assigned respondent_id, identifying the reporting entity. Stable from year to year.

fields.name: plant_name_ferc1
fields.description: Name of the plant, as reported to FERC. This is a freeform string, not guaranteed to be consistent across references to the same plant.

fields.name: plant_id_pudl
fields.description: A manually assigned PUDL plant ID. May not be constant over time.

fields.name: plant_id_eia
fields.description: The unique six-digit facility identification number, also called an ORISPL, assigned by the Energy Information Administration.

fields.name: generator_id
fields.description: Generator identification code. Often numeric, but sometimes includes letters. It's a string!

fields.name: report_date
fields.description: Date reported.

fields.name: net_generation_mwh
fields.description: Net generation for specified period in megawatthours (MWh).

fields.name: utility_id_eia
fields.description: The EIA Utility Identification number.

fields.name: utility_name_eia
fields.description: The name of the utility.

fields.name: entity_type
fields.description: Entity type of principle owner (C = Cooperative, I = Investor-Owned Utility, Q = Independent Power Producer, M = Municipally-Owned Utility, P = Political Subdivision, F = Federally-Owned Utility, S = State-Owned Utility, IND = Industrial, COM = Commercial

fields.name: plant_id_eia
fields.description: The unique six-digit facility identification number, also called an ORISPL, assigned by the Energy Information Administration.

fields.name: generator_id
fields.description: Generator identification number

fields.name: prime_mover_code
fields.description: EIA assigned code for the prime mover (i.e. the engine, turbine, water wheel, or similar machine that drives an electric generator)

fields.name: duct_burners
fields.description: Indicates whether the unit has duct-burners for supplementary firing of the turbine exhaust gas

fields.name: operating_date
fields.description: Date the generator began commercial operation

fields.name: topping_bottoming_code
fields.description: If the generator is associated with a combined heat and power system, indicates whether the generator is part of a topping cycle or a bottoming cycle

fields.name: solid_fuel_gasification
fields.description: Indicates whether the generator is part of a solid fuel gasification system

fields.name: pulverized_coal_tech
fields.description: Indicates whether the generator uses pulverized coal technology

fields.name: fluidized_bed_tech
fields.description: Indicates whether the generator uses fluidized bed technology

fields.name: subcritical_tech
fields.description: Indicates whether the generator uses subcritical technology

fields.name: supercritical_tech
fields.description: Indicates whether the generator uses supercritical technology

fields.name: ultrasupercritical_tech
fields.description: Indicates whether the generator uses ultra-supercritical technology

fields.name: stoker_tech
fields.description: Indicates whether the generator uses stoker technology

fields.name: other_combustion_tech
fields.description: Indicates whether the generator uses other combustion technologies

fields.name: bypass_heat_recovery
fields.description: Can this generator operate while bypassing the heat recovery steam generator?

fields.name: rto_iso_lmp_node_id
fields.description: The designation used to identify the price node in RTO/ISO Locational Marginal Price reports

fields.name: rto_iso_location_wholesale_reporting_id
fields.description: The designation used to report ths specific location of the wholesale sales transactions to FERC for the Electric Quarterly Report

fields.name: associated_combined_heat_power
fields.description: Indicates whether the generator is associated with a combined heat and power system

fields.name: original_planned_operating_date
fields.description: The date the generator was originally scheduled to be operational

fields.name: operating_switch
fields.description: Indicates whether the fuel switching generator can switch when operating

fields.name: previously_canceled
fields.description: Indicates whether the generator was previously reported as indefinitely postponed or canceled

resources.name: plants_hydro_ferc1
resources.title: plants_hydro_ferc1
resources.description: Hydroelectric generating plant statistics for large plants. Large plants have an installed nameplate capacity of more than 10 MW. As reported on FERC Form 1, pages 406-407, and extracted from the f1_hydro table in FERC's FoxPro database.

fields.name: record_id
fields.description: Identifier indicating original FERC Form 1 source record. format: {table_name}_{report_year}_{report_prd}_{respondent_id}_{spplmnt_num}_{row_number}. Unique within FERC Form 1 DB tables which are not row-mapped.

fields.name: utility_id_ferc1
fields.description: FERC assigned respondent_id, identifying the reporting entity. Stable from year to year.

fields.name: report_year
fields.description: Four-digit year in which the data was reported.

fields.name: plant_name_ferc1
fields.description: Name of the plant, as reported to FERC. This is a freeform string, not guaranteed to be consistent across references to the same plant.

fields.name: project_num
fields.description: FERC Licensed Project Number.

fields.name: plant_type
fields.description: Kind of plant (Run-of-River or Storage).

fields.name: construction_type
fields.description: Type of plant construction ('outdoor', 'semioutdoor', or 'conventional'). Categorized by PUDL based on our best guess of intended value in FERC1 freeform strings.

fields.name: construction_year
fields.description: Four digit year of the plant's original construction.

fields.name: installation_year
fields.description: Four digit year in which the last unit was installed.

fields.name: capacity_mw
fields.description: Total installed (nameplate) capacity, in megawatts.

fields.name: peak_demand_mw
fields.description: Net peak demand on the plant (60-minute integration), in megawatts.

fields.name: plant_hours_connected_while_generating
fields.description: Hours the plant was connected to load while generating.

fields.name: net_capacity_favorable_conditions_mw
fields.description: Net plant capability under the most favorable operating conditions, in megawatts.

fields.name: net_capacity_adverse_conditions_mw
fields.description: Net plant capability under the least favorable operating conditions, in megawatts.

fields.name: avg_num_employees
fields.description: Average number of employees.

fields.name: net_generation_mwh
fields.description: Net generation, exclusive of plant use, in megawatt hours.

fields.name: capex_land
fields.description: Cost of plant: land and land rights. Nominal USD.

fields.name: capex_structures
fields.description: Cost of plant: structures and improvements. Nominal USD.

fields.name: capex_facilities
fields.description: Cost of plant: reservoirs, dams, and waterways. Nominal USD.

fields.name: capex_equipment
fields.description: Cost of plant: equipment. Nominal USD.

fields.name: capex_roads
fields.description: Cost of plant: roads, railroads, and bridges. Nominal USD.

fields.name: asset_retirement_cost
fields.description: Cost of plant: asset retirement costs. Nominal USD.

fields.name: capex_total
fields.description: Total cost of plant. Nominal USD.

fields.name: capex_per_mw
fields.description: Cost of plant per megawatt of installed (nameplate) capacity. Nominal USD.

fields.name: opex_operations
fields.description: Production expenses: operation, supervision, and engineering. Nominal USD.

fields.name: opex_water_for_power
fields.description: Production expenses: water for power. Nominal USD.

fields.name: opex_hydraulic
fields.description: Production expenses: hydraulic expenses. Nominal USD.

fields.name: opex_electric
fields.description: Production expenses: electric expenses. Nominal USD.

fields.name: opex_generation_misc
fields.description: Production expenses: miscellaneous hydraulic power generation expenses. Nominal USD.

fields.name: opex_rents
fields.description: Production expenses: rent. Nominal USD.

fields.name: opex_engineering
fields.description: Production expenses: maintenance, supervision, and engineering. Nominal USD.

fields.name: opex_structures
fields.description: Production expenses: maintenance of structures. Nominal USD.

fields.name: opex_dams
fields.description: Production expenses: maintenance of reservoirs, dams, and waterways. Nominal USD.

fields.name: opex_plant
fields.description: Production expenses: maintenance of electric plant. Nominal USD.

fields.name: opex_misc_plant
fields.description: Production expenses: maintenance of miscellaneous hydraulic plant. Nominal USD.

fields.name: opex_total
fields.description: Total production expenses. Nominal USD.

fields.name: opex_per_mwh
fields.description: Production expenses per net megawatt hour generated. Nominal USD.

resources.name: plant_in_service_ferc1
resources.title: plant_in_service_ferc1
resources.description: Balances and changes to FERC Electric Plant in Service accounts, as reported on FERC Form 1. Data originally from the f1_plant_in_srvce table in FERC's FoxPro database. Account numbers correspond to the FERC Uniform System of Accounts for Electric Plant, which is defined in Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) Title 18, Chapter I, Subchapter C, Part 101. (See e.g. https://www.law.cornell.edu/cfr/text/18/part-101). Each FERC respondent reports starting and ending balances for each account annually. Balances are organization wide, and are not broken down on a per-plant basis. End of year balance should equal beginning year balance plus the sum of additions, retirements, adjustments, and transfers.

fields.name: utility_id_ferc1
fields.description: FERC assigned respondent_id, identifying the reporting entity. Stable from year to year.

fields.name: report_year
fields.description: Four-digit year in which the data was reported.

fields.name: amount_type
fields.description: String indicating which original FERC Form 1 column the listed amount came from. Each field should have one (potentially NA) value of each type for each utility in each year, and the ending_balance should equal the sum of starting_balance, additions, retirements, adjustments, and transfers.

fields.name: record_id
fields.description: Identifier indicating original FERC Form 1 source record. format: {table_name}_{report_year}_{report_prd}_{respondent_id}_{spplmnt_num}_{row_number}. Unique within FERC Form 1 DB tables which are not row-mapped.

resources.name: purchased_power_ferc1
resources.title: purchased_power_ferc1
resources.description: Purchased Power (Account 555) including power exchanges (i.e. transactions involving a balancing of debits and credits for energy, capacity, etc.) and any settlements for imbalanced exchanges. Reported on pages 326-327 of FERC Form 1. Extracted from the f1_purchased_pwr table in FERC's FoxPro database.

fields.name: record_id
fields.description: Identifier indicating original FERC Form 1 source record. format: {table_name}_{report_year}_{report_prd}_{respondent_id}_{spplmnt_num}_{row_number}. Unique within FERC Form 1 DB tables which are not row-mapped.

fields.name: utility_id_ferc1
fields.description: FERC assigned respondent_id, identifying the reporting entity. Stable from year to year.

fields.name: report_year
fields.description: Four-digit year in which the data was reported.

fields.name: seller_name
fields.description: Name of the seller, or the other party in an exchange transaction.

fields.name: purchase_type
fields.description: Categorization based on the original contractual terms and conditions of the service. Must be one of 'requirements', 'long_firm', 'intermediate_firm', 'short_firm', 'long_unit', 'intermediate_unit', 'electricity_exchange', 'other_service', or 'adjustment'. Requirements service is ongoing high reliability service, with load integrated into system resource planning. 'Long term' means 5+ years. 'Intermediate term' is 1-5 years. 'Short term' is less than 1 year. 'Firm' means not interruptible for economic reasons. 'unit' indicates service from a particular designated generating unit. 'exchange' is an in-kind transaction.

fields.name: tariff
fields.description: FERC Rate Schedule Number or Tariff. (Note: may be incomplete if originally reported on multiple lines.)

fields.name: billing_demand_mw
fields.description: Monthly average billing demand (for requirements purchases, and any transactions involving demand charges). In megawatts.

fields.name: non_coincident_peak_demand_mw
fields.description: Average monthly non-coincident peak (NCP) demand (for requirements purhcases, and any transactions involving demand charges). Monthly NCP demand is the maximum metered hourly (60-minute integration) demand in a month. In megawatts.

fields.name: coincident_peak_demand_mw
fields.description: Average monthly coincident peak (CP) demand (for requirements purchases, and any transactions involving demand charges). Monthly CP demand is the metered demand during the hour (60-minute integration) in which the supplier's system reaches its monthly peak. In megawatts.

fields.name: purchased_mwh
fields.description: Megawatt-hours shown on bills rendered to the respondent.

fields.name: received_mwh
fields.description: Gross megawatt-hours received in power exchanges and used as the basis for settlement.

fields.name: delivered_mwh
fields.description: Gross megawatt-hours delivered in power exchanges and used as the basis for settlement.

fields.name: demand_charges
fields.description: Demand charges. Nominal USD.

fields.name: energy_charges
fields.description: Energy charges. Nominal USD.

fields.name: other_charges
fields.description: Other charges, including out-of-period adjustments. Nominal USD.

fields.name: total_settlement
fields.description: Sum of demand, energy, and other charges. For power exchanges, the settlement amount for the net receipt of energy. If more energy was delivered than received, this amount is negative. Nominal USD.

fields.name: plant_id_eia
fields.description: The unique six-digit facility identification number, also called an ORISPL, assigned by the Energy Information Administration.

fields.name: generator_id
fields.description: Generator identification number.

fields.name: report_date
fields.description: Date reported.

fields.name: operational_status_code
fields.description: The operating status of the generator.

fields.name: operational_status
fields.description: The operating status of the generator. This is based on which tab the generator was listed in in EIA 860.

fields.name: ownership_code
fields.description: Identifies the ownership for each generator.

fields.name: utility_id_eia
fields.description: EIA-assigned identification number for the company that is responsible for the day-to-day operations of the generator.

fields.name: capacity_mw
fields.description: The highest value on the generator nameplate in megawatts rounded to the nearest tenth.

fields.name: summer_capacity_mw
fields.description: The net summer capacity.

fields.name: winter_capacity_mw
fields.description: The net winter capacity.

fields.name: energy_source_code_1
fields.description: The code representing the most predominant type of energy that fuels the generator.

fields.name: energy_source_code_2
fields.description: The code representing the second most predominant type of energy that fuels the generator

fields.name: energy_source_code_3
fields.description: The code representing the third most predominant type of energy that fuels the generator

fields.name: energy_source_code_4
fields.description: The code representing the fourth most predominant type of energy that fuels the generator

fields.name: energy_source_code_5
fields.description: The code representing the fifth most predominant type of energy that fuels the generator

fields.name: energy_source_code_6
fields.description: The code representing the sixth most predominant type of energy that fuels the generator

fields.name: fuel_type_code_pudl
fields.description: Standardized fuel codes in PUDL.

fields.name: multiple_fuels
fields.description: Can the generator burn multiple fuels?

fields.name: deliver_power_transgrid
fields.description: Indicate whether the generator can deliver power to the transmission grid.

fields.name: syncronized_transmission_grid
fields.description: Indicates whether standby generators (SB status) can be synchronized to the grid.

fields.name: turbines_num
fields.description: Number of wind turbines, or hydrokinetic buoys.

fields.name: planned_modifications
fields.description: Indicates whether there are any planned capacity uprates/derates, repowering, other modifications, or generator retirements scheduled for the next 5 years.

fields.name: planned_net_summer_capacity_uprate_mw
fields.description: Increase in summer capacity expected to be realized from the modification to the equipment.

fields.name: planned_net_winter_capacity_uprate_mw
fields.description: Increase in winter capacity expected to be realized from the uprate modification to the equipment.

fields.name: planned_uprate_date
fields.description: Planned effective date that the generator is scheduled to enter operation after the uprate modification.

fields.name: planned_net_summer_capacity_derate_mw
fields.description: Decrease in summer capacity expected to be realized from the derate modification to the equipment.

fields.name: planned_net_winter_capacity_derate_mw
fields.description: Decrease in winter capacity expected to be realized from the derate modification to the equipment.

fields.name: planned_derate_date
fields.description: Planned effective month that the generator is scheduled to enter operation after the derate modification.

fields.name: planned_new_prime_mover_code
fields.description: New prime mover for the planned repowered generator.

fields.name: planned_energy_source_code_1
fields.description: New energy source code for the planned repowered generator.

fields.name: planned_repower_date
fields.description: Planned effective date that the generator is scheduled to enter operation after the repowering is complete.

fields.name: other_planned_modifications
fields.description: Indicates whether there are there other modifications planned for the generator.

fields.name: other_modifications_date
fields.description: Planned effective date that the generator is scheduled to enter commercial operation after any other planned modification is complete.

fields.name: planned_retirement_date
fields.description: Planned effective date of the scheduled retirement of the generator.

fields.name: carbon_capture
fields.description: Indicates whether the generator uses carbon capture technology.

fields.name: startup_source_code_1
fields.description: The code representing the first, second, third or fourth start-up and flame stabilization energy source used by the combustion unit(s) associated with this generator.

fields.name: startup_source_code_2
fields.description: The code representing the first, second, third or fourth start-up and flame stabilization energy source used by the combustion unit(s) associated with this generator.

fields.name: startup_source_code_3
fields.description: The code representing the first, second, third or fourth start-up and flame stabilization energy source used by the combustion unit(s) associated with this generator.

fields.name: startup_source_code_4
fields.description: The code representing the first, second, third or fourth start-up and flame stabilization energy source used by the combustion unit(s) associated with this generator.

fields.name: technology_description
fields.description: High level description of the technology used by the generator to produce electricity.

fields.name: turbines_inverters_hydrokinetics
fields.description: Number of wind turbines, or hydrokinetic buoys.

fields.name: time_cold_shutdown_full_load_code
fields.description: The minimum amount of time required to bring the unit to full load from shutdown.

fields.name: planned_new_capacity_mw
fields.description: The expected new namplate capacity for the generator.

fields.name: cofire_fuels
fields.description: Can the generator co-fire fuels?.

fields.name: switch_oil_gas
fields.description: Indicates whether the generator switch between oil and natural gas.

fields.name: nameplate_power_factor
fields.description: The nameplate power factor of the generator.

fields.name: minimum_load_mw
fields.description: The minimum load at which the generator can operate at continuosuly.

fields.name: uprate_derate_during_year
fields.description: Was an uprate or derate completed on this generator during the reporting year?

fields.name: uprate_derate_completed_date
fields.description: The date when the uprate or derate was completed.

fields.name: current_planned_operating_date
fields.description: The most recently updated effective date on which the generator is scheduled to start operation

fields.name: summer_estimated_capability_mw
fields.description: EIA estimated summer capacity (in MWh).

fields.name: winter_estimated_capability_mw
fields.description: EIA estimated winter capacity (in MWh).

fields.name: retirement_date
fields.description: Date of the scheduled or effected retirement of the generator.

fields.name: report_date
fields.description: Date reported.

fields.name: utility_id_eia
fields.description: EIA-assigned identification number for the company that is responsible for the day-to-day operations of the generator.

fields.name: plant_id_eia
fields.description: The unique six-digit facility identification number, also called an ORISPL, assigned by the Energy Information Administration.

fields.name: generator_id
fields.description: Generator identification number.

fields.name: owner_utility_id_eia
fields.description: EIA-assigned owner's identification number.

fields.name: owner_name
fields.description: Name of owner.

fields.name: owner_state
fields.description: Two letter US & Canadian state and territory abbreviations.

fields.name: owner_city
fields.description: City of owner.

fields.name: owner_street_address
fields.description: Steet address of owner.

fields.name: owner_zip_code
fields.description: Zip code of owner.

fields.name: fraction_owned
fields.description: Proportion of generator ownership.

resources.name: plants_pudl
resources.title: PUDL Plants
resources.description: Home table for PUDL assigned plant IDs. These IDs are manually generated each year when new FERC and EIA reporting is integrated, and any newly identified plants are added to the list with a new ID. Each ID maps to a power plant which is reported in at least one FERC or EIA data set. This table is read in from a spreadsheet stored in the PUDL repository: src/pudl/package_data/glue/mapping_eia923_ferc1.xlsx

fields.name: plant_id_pudl
fields.description: A manually assigned PUDL plant ID. May not be constant over time.

fields.name: plant_name_pudl
fields.description: Plant name, chosen arbitrarily from the several possible plant names available in the plant matching process. Included for human readability only.

resources.name: accumulated_depreciation_ferc1
resources.title: accumulated_depreciation_ferc1
resources.description: Balances and changes to FERC Accumulated Provision for Depreciation.

fields.name: utility_id_ferc1
fields.description: FERC-assigned respondent_id, identifying the reporting entity. Stable from year to year.

fields.name: report_year
fields.description: Four-digit year in which the data was reported.

fields.name: record_id
fields.description: Identifier indicating original FERC Form 1 source record. format: {table_name}_{report_year}_{report_prd}_{respondent_id}_{spplmnt_num}_{row_number}. Unique within FERC Form 1 DB tables which are not row-mapped.

fields.name: line_id
fields.description: Line numbers, and corresponding FERC account number from FERC Form 1, page 2019, Accumulated Provision for Depreciation of Electric Utility Plant (Account 108).

fields.name: total
fields.description: Total of Electric Plant In Service, Electric Plant Held for Future Use, and Electric Plant Leased to Others. Nominal USD.

fields.name: electric_plant
fields.description: Electric Plant In Service. Nominal USD.

fields.name: future_plant
fields.description: Electric Plant Held for Future Use. Nominal USD.

fields.name: leased_plant
fields.description: Electric Plant Leased to Others. Nominal USD.

fields.name: id
fields.description: PUDL issued surrogate key.

fields.name: plant_id_eia
fields.description: The unique six-digit facility identification number, also called an ORISPL, assigned by the Energy Information Administration.

fields.name: report_date
fields.description: Date reported.

fields.name: contract_type_code
fields.description: Purchase type under which receipts occurred in the reporting month. C: Contract, NC: New Contract, S: Spot Purchase, T: Tolling Agreement.

fields.name: contract_expiration_date
fields.description: Date contract expires.Format:  MMYY.

fields.name: energy_source_code
fields.description: The fuel code associated with the fuel receipt. Two or three character alphanumeric.

fields.name: fuel_type_code_pudl
fields.description: Standardized fuel codes in PUDL.

fields.name: fuel_group_code
fields.description: Groups the energy sources into fuel groups that are located in the Electric Power Monthly:  Coal, Natural Gas, Petroleum, Petroleum Coke.

fields.name: fuel_group_code_simple
fields.description: Simplified grouping of fuel_group_code, with Coal and Petroluem Coke as well as Natural Gas and Other Gas grouped together.

fields.name: mine_id_pudl
fields.description: PUDL mine identification number.

fields.name: supplier_name
fields.description: Company that sold the fuel to the plant or, in the case of Natural Gas, pipline owner.

fields.name: fuel_qty_units
fields.description: Quanity of fuel received in tons, barrel, or Mcf.

fields.name: heat_content_mmbtu_per_unit
fields.description: Heat content of the fuel in millions of Btus per physical unit to the nearest 0.01 percent.

fields.name: sulfur_content_pct
fields.description: Sulfur content percentage by weight to the nearest 0.01 percent.

fields.name: ash_content_pct
fields.description: Ash content percentage by weight to the nearest 0.1 percent.

fields.name: mercury_content_ppm
fields.description: Mercury content in parts per million (ppm) to the nearest 0.001 ppm.

fields.name: fuel_cost_per_mmbtu
fields.description: All costs incurred in the purchase and delivery of the fuel to the plant in cents per million Btu(MMBtu) to the nearest 0.1 cent.

fields.name: primary_transportation_mode_code
fields.description: Transportation mode for the longest distance transported.

fields.name: secondary_transportation_mode_code
fields.description: Transportation mode for the second longest distance transported.

fields.name: natural_gas_transport_code
fields.description: Contract type for natural gas transportation service.

fields.name: natural_gas_delivery_contract_type_code
fields.description: Contract type for natrual gas delivery service:

resources.name: utilities_ferc1
resources.title: utilities_ferc1
resources.description: This table maps the manually assigned PUDL utility ID to a FERC respondent ID, enabling a connection between the FERC and EIA data sets. It also stores the utility name associated with the FERC respondent ID. Those values originate in the f1_respondent_id table in FERC's FoxPro database, which is stored in a file called F1_1.DBF. This table is generated from a spreadsheet stored in the PUDL repository: results/id_mapping/mapping_eia923_ferc1.xlsx

fields.name: utility_id_ferc1
fields.description: FERC assigned respondent_id, identifying the reporting entity. Stable from year to year.

fields.name: utility_name_ferc1
fields.description: Name of the responding utility, as it is reported in FERC Form 1. For human readability only.

fields.name: utility_id_pudl
fields.description: A manually assigned PUDL utility ID. May not be stable over time.

fields.name: plant_id_eia
fields.description: The unique six-digit facility identification number, also called an ORISPL, assigned by the Energy Information Administration.

fields.name: report_date
fields.description: Date reported.

fields.name: generator_id
fields.description: EIA-assigned generator identification code.

fields.name: boiler_id
fields.description: EIA-assigned boiler identification code.

fields.name: unit_id_eia
fields.description: EIA-assigned unit identification code.

fields.name: unit_id_pudl
fields.description: PUDL-assigned unit identification number.

fields.name: bga_source
fields.description: The source from where the unit_id_pudl is compiled. The unit_id_pudl comes directly from EIA 860, or string association (which looks at all the boilers and generators that are not associated with a unit and tries to find a matching string in the respective collection of boilers or generator), or from a unit connection (where the unit_id_eia is employed to find additional boiler generator connections).

fields.name: mine_id_pudl
fields.description: PUDL issued surrogate key.

fields.name: mine_name
fields.description: Coal mine name.

fields.name: mine_type_code
fields.description: Type of mine. P: Preparation plant, U: Underground, S: Surface, SU: Mostly Surface with some Underground, US: Mostly Underground with some Surface.

fields.name: state
fields.description: Two letter US state abbreviations and three letter ISO-3166-1 country codes for international mines.

fields.name: county_id_fips
fields.description: County ID from the Federal Information Processing Standard Publication 6-4.

fields.name: mine_id_msha
fields.description: MSHA issued mine identifier.

fields.name: plant_id_eia
fields.description: The unique six-digit facility identification number, also called an ORISPL, assigned by the Energy Information Administration.

resources.name: ferc_accounts
resources.title: ferc_accounts
resources.description: Account numbers from the FERC Uniform System of Accounts for Electric Plant, which is defined in Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) Title 18, Chapter I, Subchapter C, Part 101. (See e.g. https://www.law.cornell.edu/cfr/text/18/part-101).

fields.name: ferc_account_id
fields.description: Account number, from FERC's Uniform System of Accounts for Electric Plant. Also includes higher level labeled categories.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Long description of the FERC Account.

fields.name: plant_id_eia
fields.description: The unique six-digit facility identification number, also called an ORISPL, assigned by the Energy Information Administration.

fields.name: report_date
fields.description: Date reported.

fields.name: ash_impoundment
fields.description: Is there an ash impoundment (e.g. pond, reservoir) at the plant?

fields.name: ash_impoundment_lined
fields.description: If there is an ash impoundment at the plant, is the impoundment lined?

fields.name: ash_impoundment_status
fields.description: If there is an ash impoundment at the plant, the ash impoundment status as of December 31 of the reporting year.

fields.name: energy_storage
fields.description: Indicates if the facility has energy storage capabilities.

fields.name: ferc_cogen_docket_no
fields.description: The docket number relating to the FERC qualifying facility cogenerator status.

fields.name: ferc_exempt_wholesale_generator_docket_no
fields.description: The docket number relating to the FERC qualifying facility exempt wholesale generator status.

fields.name: ferc_small_power_producer_docket_no
fields.description: The docket number relating to the FERC qualifying facility small power producer status.

fields.name: liquefied_natural_gas_storage
fields.description: Indicates if the facility have the capability to store the natural gas in the form of liquefied natural gas.

fields.name: natural_gas_local_distribution_company
fields.description: Names of Local Distribution Company (LDC), connected to natural gas burning power plants.

fields.name: natural_gas_storage
fields.description: Indicates if the facility have on-site storage of natural gas.

fields.name: natural_gas_pipeline_name_1
fields.description: The name of the owner or operator of natural gas pipeline that connects directly to this facility or that connects to a lateral pipeline owned by this facility.

fields.name: natural_gas_pipeline_name_2
fields.description: The name of the owner or operator of natural gas pipeline that connects directly to this facility or that connects to a lateral pipeline owned by this facility.

fields.name: natural_gas_pipeline_name_3
fields.description: The name of the owner or operator of natural gas pipeline that connects directly to this facility or that connects to a lateral pipeline owned by this facility.

fields.name: net_metering
fields.description: Did this plant have a net metering agreement in effect during the reporting year?  (Only displayed for facilities that report the sun or wind as an energy source). This field was only reported up until 2015

fields.name: pipeline_notes
fields.description: Additional owner or operator of natural gas pipeline.

fields.name: regulatory_status_code
fields.description: Indicates whether the plant is regulated or non-regulated.

fields.name: transmission_distribution_owner_id
fields.description: EIA-assigned code for owner of transmission/distribution system to which the plant is interconnected.

fields.name: transmission_distribution_owner_name
fields.description: Name of the owner of the transmission or distribution system to which the plant is interconnected.

fields.name: transmission_distribution_owner_state
fields.description: State location for owner of transmission/distribution system to which the plant is interconnected.

fields.name: utility_id_eia
fields.description: EIA-assigned identification number for the company that is responsible for the day-to-day operations of the generator.

fields.name: water_source
fields.description: Name of water source associater with the plant.

fields.name: plant_id_eia
fields.description: The unique six-digit facility identification number, also called an ORISPL, assigned by the Energy Information Administration.

fields.name: report_date
fields.description: Date reported.

fields.name: nuclear_unit_id
fields.description: For nuclear plants only, the unit number .One digit numeric. Nuclear plants are the only type of plants for which data are shown explicitly at the generating unit level.

fields.name: fuel_type
fields.description: The fuel code reported to EIA. Two or three letter alphanumeric.

fields.name: fuel_type_code_pudl
fields.description: Standardized fuel codes in PUDL.

fields.name: fuel_type_code_aer
fields.description: A partial aggregation of the reported fuel type codes into larger categories used by EIA in, for example, the Annual Energy Review (AER).Two or three letter alphanumeric.

fields.name: prime_mover_code
fields.description: Type of prime mover.

fields.name: fuel_consumed_units
fields.description: Consumption of the fuel type in physical units. Note: this is the total quantity consumed for both electricity and, in the case of combined heat and power plants, process steam production.

fields.name: fuel_consumed_for_electricity_units
fields.description: Consumption for electric generation of the fuel type in physical units.

fields.name: fuel_mmbtu_per_unit
fields.description: Heat content of the fuel in millions of Btus per physical unit.

fields.name: fuel_consumed_mmbtu
fields.description: Total consumption of fuel in physical units, year to date. Note: this is the total quantity consumed for both electricity and, in the case of combined heat and power plants, process steam production.

fields.name: fuel_consumed_for_electricity_mmbtu
fields.description: Total consumption of fuel to produce electricity, in physical units, year to date.

fields.name: net_generation_mwh
fields.description: Net generation, year to date in megawatthours (MWh). This is total electrical output net of station service.  In the case of combined heat and power plants, this value is intended to include internal consumption of electricity for the purposes of a production process, as well as power put on the grid.

resources.name: plants_small_ferc1
resources.title: plants_small_ferc1
resources.description: Generating plant statistics for small plants, as reported on FERC Form 1 pages 410-411, and extracted from the FERC FoxPro database table f1_gnrt_plant. Small generating plants are defined by having nameplate capacity of less than 25MW for steam plants, and less than 10MW for internal combustion, conventional hydro, and pumped storage plants.

fields.name: record_id
fields.description: Identifier indicating original FERC Form 1 source record. format: {table_name}_{report_year}_{report_prd}_{respondent_id}_{spplmnt_num}_{row_number}. Unique within FERC Form 1 DB tables which are not row-mapped.

fields.name: utility_id_ferc1
fields.description: FERC assigned respondent_id, identifying the reporting entity. Stable from year to year.

fields.name: report_year
fields.description: Four-digit year in which the data was reported.

fields.name: plant_name_original
fields.description: Original plant name in the FERC Form 1 FoxPro database.

fields.name: plant_name_ferc1
fields.description: PUDL assigned simplified plant name.

fields.name: plant_type
fields.description: PUDL assigned plant type. This is a best guess based on the fuel type, plant name, and other attributes.

fields.name: ferc_license_id
fields.description: FERC issued operating license ID for the facility, if available. This value is extracted from the original plant name where possible.

fields.name: construction_year
fields.description: Original year of plant construction.

fields.name: capacity_mw
fields.description: Name plate capacity in megawatts.

fields.name: peak_demand_mw
fields.description: Net peak demand for 60 minutes. Note: in some cases peak demand for other time periods may have been reported instead, if hourly peak demand was unavailable.

fields.name: net_generation_mwh
fields.description: Net generation excluding plant use, in megawatt-hours.

fields.name: total_cost_of_plant
fields.description: Total cost of plant. Nominal USD.

fields.name: capex_per_mw
fields.description: Plant costs (including asset retirement costs) per megawatt. Nominal USD.

fields.name: opex_total
fields.description: Total plant operating expenses, excluding fuel. Nominal USD.

fields.name: opex_fuel
fields.description: Production expenses: Fuel. Nominal USD.

fields.name: opex_maintenance
fields.description: Production expenses: Maintenance. Nominal USD.

fields.name: fuel_type
fields.description: Kind of fuel. Originally reported to FERC as a freeform string. Assigned a canonical value by PUDL based on our best guess.

fields.name: fuel_cost_per_mmbtu
fields.description: Average fuel cost per mmBTU (if applicable). Nominal USD.

fields.name: record_id
fields.description: Identifier indicating original FERC Form 1 source record. format: {table_name}_{report_year}_{report_prd}_{respondent_id}_{spplmnt_num}_{row_number}. Unique within FERC Form 1 DB tables which are not row-mapped.

fields.name: utility_id_ferc1
fields.description: FERC assigned respondent_id, identifying the reporting entity. Stable from year to year.

fields.name: report_year
fields.description: Four-digit year in which the data was reported.

fields.name: plant_name_ferc1
fields.description: Name of the plant, as reported to FERC. This is a freeform string, not guaranteed to be consistent across references to the same plant.

fields.name: project_num
fields.description: FERC Licensed Project Number.

fields.name: construction_type
fields.description: Type of plant construction ('outdoor', 'semioutdoor', or 'conventional'). Categorized by PUDL based on our best guess of intended value in FERC1 freeform strings.

fields.name: construction_year
fields.description: Four digit year of the plant's original construction.

fields.name: installation_year
fields.description: Four digit year in which the last unit was installed.

fields.name: capacity_mw
fields.description: Total installed (nameplate) capacity, in megawatts.

fields.name: peak_demand_mw
fields.description: Net peak demand on the plant (60-minute integration), in megawatts.

fields.name: plant_hours_connected_while_generating
fields.description: Hours the plant was connected to load while generating.

fields.name: plant_capability_mw
fields.description: Net plant capability in megawatts.

fields.name: avg_num_employees
fields.description: Average number of employees.

fields.name: net_generation_mwh
fields.description: Net generation, exclusive of plant use, in megawatt hours.

fields.name: energy_used_for_pumping_mwh
fields.description: Energy used for pumping, in megawatt-hours.

fields.name: net_load_mwh
fields.description: Net output for load (net generation - energy used for pumping) in megawatt-hours.

fields.name: capex_land
fields.description: Cost of plant: land and land rights. Nominal USD.

fields.name: capex_structures
fields.description: Cost of plant: structures and improvements. Nominal USD.

fields.name: capex_facilities
fields.description: Cost of plant: reservoirs, dams, and waterways. Nominal USD.

fields.name: capex_wheels_turbines_generators
fields.description: Cost of plant: water wheels, turbines, and generators. Nominal USD.

fields.name: capex_equipment_electric
fields.description: Cost of plant: accessory electric equipment. Nominal USD.

fields.name: capex_equipment_misc
fields.description: Cost of plant: miscellaneous power plant equipment. Nominal USD.

fields.name: capex_roads
fields.description: Cost of plant: roads, railroads, and bridges. Nominal USD.

fields.name: asset_retirement_cost
fields.description: Cost of plant: asset retirement costs. Nominal USD.

fields.name: capex_total
fields.description: Total cost of plant. Nominal USD.

fields.name: capex_per_mw
fields.description: Cost of plant per megawatt of installed (nameplate) capacity. Nominal USD.

fields.name: opex_operations
fields.description: Production expenses: operation, supervision, and engineering. Nominal USD.

fields.name: opex_water_for_power
fields.description: Production expenses: water for power. Nominal USD.

fields.name: opex_pumped_storage
fields.description: Production expenses: pumped storage. Nominal USD.

fields.name: opex_electric
fields.description: Production expenses: electric expenses. Nominal USD.

fields.name: opex_generation_misc
fields.description: Production expenses: miscellaneous pumped storage power generation expenses. Nominal USD.

fields.name: opex_rents
fields.description: Production expenses: rent. Nominal USD.

fields.name: opex_engineering
fields.description: Production expenses: maintenance, supervision, and engineering. Nominal USD.

fields.name: opex_structures
fields.description: Production expenses: maintenance of structures. Nominal USD.

fields.name: opex_dams
fields.description: Production expenses: maintenance of reservoirs, dams, and waterways. Nominal USD.

fields.name: opex_plant
fields.description: Production expenses: maintenance of electric plant. Nominal USD.

fields.name: opex_misc_plant
fields.description: Production expenses: maintenance of miscellaneous hydraulic plant. Nominal USD.

fields.name: opex_production_before_pumping
fields.description: Total production expenses before pumping. Nominal USD.

fields.name: opex_pumping
fields.description: Production expenses: We are here to PUMP YOU UP! Nominal USD.

fields.name: opex_total
fields.description: Total production expenses. Nominal USD.

fields.name: opex_per_mwh
fields.description: Production expenses per net megawatt hour generated. Nominal USD.

fields.name: plant_id_eia
fields.description: The unique six-digit facility identification number, also called an ORISPL, assigned by the Energy Information Administration.

fields.name: boiler_id
fields.description: Boiler identification code. Alphanumeric.

fields.name: fuel_type_code
fields.description: The fuel code reported to EIA. Two or three letter alphanumeric.

fields.name: fuel_type_code_pudl
fields.description: Standardized fuel codes in PUDL.

fields.name: report_date
fields.description: Date reported.

fields.name: fuel_consumed_units
fields.description: Consumption of the fuel type in physical units. Note: this is the total quantity consumed for both electricity and, in the case of combined heat and power plants, process steam production.

fields.name: fuel_mmbtu_per_unit
fields.description: Heat content of the fuel in millions of Btus per physical unit.

fields.name: sulfur_content_pct
fields.description: Sulfur content percentage by weight to the nearest 0.01 percent.

fields.name: ash_content_pct
fields.description: Ash content percentage by weight to the nearest 0.1 percent.

fields.name: state
fields.description: State the plant is located in.

fields.name: plant_id_eia
fields.description: The unique six-digit facility identification number, also called an ORISPL, assigned by the Energy Information Administration.

fields.name: unitid
fields.description: Facility-specific unit id (e.g. Unit 4)

fields.name: operating_datetime_utc
fields.description: Date and time measurement began (UTC).

fields.name: operating_time_hours
fields.description: Length of time interval measured.

fields.name: gross_load_mw
fields.description: Average power in megawatts delivered during time interval measured.

fields.name: steam_load_1000_lbs
fields.description: Total steam pressure produced by a unit during the reported hour.

fields.name: so2_mass_lbs
fields.description: Sulfur dioxide emissions in pounds.

fields.name: so2_mass_measurement_code
fields.description: Identifies whether the reported value of emissions was measured, calculated, or measured and substitute.

fields.name: nox_rate_lbs_mmbtu
fields.description: The average rate at which NOx was emitted during a given time period.

fields.name: nox_rate_measurement_code
fields.description: Identifies whether the reported value of emissions was measured, calculated, or measured and substitute.

fields.name: nox_mass_lbs
fields.description: NOx emissions in pounds.

fields.name: nox_mass_measurement_code
fields.description: Identifies whether the reported value of emissions was measured, calculated, or measured and substitute.

fields.name: co2_mass_tons
fields.description: Carbon dioxide emissions in short tons.

fields.name: co2_mass_measurement_code
fields.description: Identifies whether the reported value of emissions was measured, calculated, or measured and substitute.

fields.name: heat_content_mmbtu
fields.description: The energy contained in fuel burned, measured in million BTU.

fields.name: facility_id
fields.description: New EPA plant ID.

fields.name: unit_id_epa
fields.description: New EPA unit ID.

fields.name: region_from
fields.description: Name of the IPM region sending electricity

fields.name: region_to
fields.description: Name of the IPM region receiving electricity

fields.name: firm_ttc_mw
fields.description: Transfer capacity with N-1 lines (used for reserve margins)

fields.name: nonfirm_ttc_mw
fields.description: Transfer capacity with N-0 lines (used for energy sales)

fields.name: tariff_mills_kwh
fields.description: Cost to transfer electricity between regions

resources.name: plants_steam_ferc1
resources.title: plants_steam_ferc1
resources.description: Large thermal generating plants, as reported on page 402 of FERC Form 1.

fields.name: record_id
fields.description: Identifier indicating original FERC Form 1 source record. format: {table_name}_{report_year}_{report_prd}_{respondent_id}_{spplmnt_num}_{row_number}. Unique within FERC Form 1 DB tables which are not row-mapped.

fields.name: utility_id_ferc1
fields.description: FERC assigned respondent_id, identifying the reporting entity. Stable from year to year.

fields.name: report_year
fields.description: Four-digit year in which the data was reported.

fields.name: plant_id_ferc1
fields.description: Algorithmically assigned PUDL FERC Plant ID. WARNING: NOT STABLE BETWEEN PUDL DB INITIALIZATIONS.

fields.name: plant_name_ferc1
fields.description: Name of the plant, as reported to FERC. This is a freeform string, not guaranteed to be consistent across references to the same plant.

fields.name: plant_type
fields.description: Simplified plant type, categorized by PUDL based on our best guess of what was intended based on freeform string reported to FERC. Unidentifiable types are null.

fields.name: construction_type
fields.description: Type of plant construction ('outdoor', 'semioutdoor', or 'conventional'). Categorized by PUDL based on our best guess of intended value in FERC1 freeform strings.

fields.name: construction_year
fields.description: Year the plant's oldest still operational unit was built.

fields.name: installation_year
fields.description: Year the plant's most recently built unit was installed.

fields.name: capacity_mw
fields.description: Total installed plant capacity in MW.

fields.name: peak_demand_mw
fields.description: Net peak demand experienced by the plant in MW in report year.

fields.name: plant_hours_connected_while_generating
fields.description: Total number hours the plant was generated and connected to load during report year.

fields.name: plant_capability_mw
fields.description: Net continuous plant capability in MW

fields.name: water_limited_capacity_mw
fields.description: Plant capacity in MW when limited by condenser water.

fields.name: not_water_limited_capacity_mw
fields.description: Plant capacity in MW when not limited by condenser water.

fields.name: avg_num_employees
fields.description: Average number of plant employees during report year.

fields.name: net_generation_mwh
fields.description: Net generation (exclusive of plant use) in MWh during report year.

fields.name: capex_land
fields.description: Capital expense for land and land rights.

fields.name: capex_structures
fields.description: Capital expense for structures and improvements.

fields.name: capex_equipment
fields.description: Capital expense for equipment.

fields.name: capex_total
fields.description: Total capital expenses.

fields.name: capex_per_mw
fields.description: Capital expenses per MW of installed plant capacity.

fields.name: opex_operations
fields.description: Production expenses: operations, supervision, and engineering.

fields.name: opex_fuel
fields.description: Total cost of fuel.

fields.name: opex_coolants
fields.description: Cost of coolants and water (nuclear plants only)

fields.name: opex_steam
fields.description: Steam expenses.

fields.name: opex_steam_other
fields.description: Steam from other sources.

fields.name: opex_transfer
fields.description: Steam transferred (Credit).

fields.name: opex_electric
fields.description: Electricity expenses.

fields.name: opex_misc_power
fields.description: Miscellaneous steam (or nuclear) expenses.

fields.name: opex_rents
fields.description: Rents.

fields.name: opex_allowances
fields.description: Allowances.

fields.name: opex_engineering
fields.description: Maintenance, supervision, and engineering.

fields.name: opex_structures
fields.description: Maintenance of structures.

fields.name: opex_boiler
fields.description: Maintenance of boiler (or reactor) plant.

fields.name: opex_plants
fields.description: Maintenance of electrical plant.

fields.name: opex_misc_steam
fields.description: Maintenance of miscellaneous steam (or nuclear) plant.

fields.name: opex_production_total
fields.description: Total operating epxenses.

fields.name: opex_per_mwh
fields.description: Total operating expenses per MWh of net generation.

fields.name: asset_retirement_cost
fields.description: Asset retirement cost.

fields.name: utility_id_eia
fields.description: EIA-assigned identification number for the company that is responsible for the day-to-day operations of the generator.

fields.name: report_date
fields.description: Date reported.

fields.name: street_address
fields.description: Street address of the operator/owner

fields.name: city
fields.description: Name of the city in which operator/owner is located

fields.name: state
fields.description: State of the operator/owner

fields.name: zip_code
fields.description: Zip code of the operator/owner

fields.name: plants_reported_owner
fields.description: Is the reporting entity an owner of power plants reported on Schedule 2 of the form?

fields.name: plants_reported_operator
fields.description: Is the reporting entity an operator of power plants reported on Schedule 2 of the form?

fields.name: plants_reported_asset_manager
fields.description: Is the reporting entity an asset manager of power plants reported on Schedule 2 of the form?

fields.name: plants_reported_other_relationship
fields.description: Does the reporting entity have any other relationship to the power plants reported on Schedule 2 of the form?

fields.name: plant_id_eia
fields.description: The unique six-digit facility identification number, also called an ORISPL, assigned by the Energy Information Administration.

fields.name: boiler_id
fields.description: The EIA-assigned boiler identification code. Alphanumeric.

fields.name: prime_mover_code
fields.description: Code for the type of prime mover (e.g. CT, CG)

fields.description: The unique six-digit facility identification number, also called an ORISPL, assigned by the Energy Information Administration.

fields.description: Plant name.

fields.description: The plant's balancing authority name.

fields.description: The plant's county.

fields.description: Indicates whether the plant has FERC qualifying facility cogenerator status.

fields.name: ferc_small_power_producer

fields.name: iso_rto_code
fields.description: The code of the plant's ISO or RTO. NA if not reported in that year.

fields.name: latitude
fields.description: Latitude of the plant's location, in degrees.

fields.name: nerc_region
fields.description: NERC region in which the plant is located

fields.name: primary_purpose_naics_id
fields.description: North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code that best describes the primary purpose of the reporting plant

fields.name: sector_name
